class.name: SentryTimestamp
class.description: A timestamp representation used in Sentry events, providing precise time tracking with microsecond resolution. [SentryTimestamp] instances can be created in several ways: from microseconds since the Unix epoch using [method SentryTimestamp.from_microseconds_since_unix_epoch], from Unix time (seconds as a float) using [method SentryTimestamp.from_unix_time], or by parsing RFC 3339 formatted timestamp strings using [method SentryTimestamp.parse_rfc3339].

method.name: equals
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this timestamp is equal to the [param]other[/param] timestamp.

method.name: from_microseconds_since_unix_epoch
method.description: Creates a new [SentryTimestamp] instance from the given number of microseconds since the Unix epoch (January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC).

method.name: from_unix_time
method.description: Creates a new [SentryTimestamp] instance from the given Unix time. Unix time is a floating-point number representing the number of seconds since the Unix epoch (January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC).

method.name: parse_rfc3339
method.description: Creates a new [SentryTimestamp] instance from the given RFC 3339 formatted string. The format should be YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssssssssZ (UTC) or YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssssssssÂ±HH:MM (with timezone offset), for example: [code]2025-05-02T02:09:40.376530Z[/code].

method.name: to_rfc3339
method.description: Converts this timestamp to an RFC 3339 formatted string in UTC. The returned string follows the format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.ssssssZ, for example: [code]2025-05-02T02:09:40.376534Z[/code].

members.member: Microseconds passed since the Unix epoch (January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC).
